I think we can go a little bit further. The sculk catalyst stores the souls of dead mobs (animation of souls). What if you collect the souls (right click the catalyst) to give the horn a durability (1-3 uses per fill). Whenever you use it a loud sound goes through the caves from the souls that get released. This will stun the warden for a few seconds. But makes it that you need to plan your trip to the deep dark cities AND that you can't spam the item.
So when you use the Goat Horn when the Warden is near, the Warden will play a dizzy animation for about 4 to 5 seconds while the player tried their best to escape. Brilliant!! I hope this gets added!

The phantom spawns there take away the one unique property of that biome. I always use the island to avoid mobs. The peaceful nature is the biggest incentive to find it for me.
Yes, this should be fixed. The peaceful nature of the mushroom island was a huge draw for me as a new player, and it is important for builders as well.

This and drowned, especially trident drowned completely destroy gameplay. There is not much benefit from a mushroom island, except that it's peaceful, at least in 1.12.2 and below. A good mushroom island can be many kilometers away in the nether and I myself, by hand, build ice boat tunnels with nice walls to get there. It's so sad that it's not peaceful anymore. Mushroom biomes were the closest thing we had to a functioning peaceful mode.
Reasons why I believe Phantoms should not spawn in Mushroom Island Biomes listed as follows:

1. eliminates purpose for exploring to find mushroom islands.  Exploration is a fun, important part of minecraft.  Making mushroom islands have hostile mobs makes them one LESS cool thing to find.  With phantoms, the only reason I can think of, to find a mushroom island biome, would be to collect mycelium to grow mushrooms elsewhere.  However, since podozol can be made from dirt, this reason (which isn't a strong one to start since mushrooms are easy to grow) isn't exactly motivating.  The whole appeal of mushroom island biomes is generally to be able to do stuff outside continuously without being harassed by monsters, which is now not possible. The other use, is as a place to build structures that monsters cannot coexist with, which brings me to the next reason-

1. It functionally limits what structures the player can build.  Building stuff is the heart of what makes minecraft great.  There are tons of things to build that cannot coexist with monsters.  Because of phantoms, those things are now restricted to worlds on the peaceful setting and can never be in the same world as the rest of the players buildings and accomplishments.  Such structures, using one of my worlds as an example could be-

-transparent ice sliding grounds or transparent ice boat race tracks that are exposed to the sky

-tree growing areas that are to be harvested at night

-farmlands that are exposed to the sky and to be harvested at night

-no doubt many ideas that come to others instead of myself

1. It pushes the player to do things underground, because the sky is no longer a cool view, it is now a safety liability.
  2. players who already built things on mushroom islands with the premise of no monsters will find their structures unuseable, and will not be able to use or build them anywhere in a non-peaceful world.
  3. since beds cannot be slept in the day, if the player wants to do something at night in the absence of phantoms, this mechanic can force the player to do nothing next to their bed, waiting until night, only to sleep in their bed, then to wait another full day until night.  That is alot of waiting and not much playing.

I would also say that phantoms make beds too important, and they pretty much force any new game to revolve around killing sheep, as islands and other previously defensible spaces are now vulnerable to phantom attacks, but that really is not related to mushroom islands, and is only a temporary inconvenience affecting gameplay only briefly.

The fact that there are multiple threads on how to deal with this such that finding the command to kill all phantoms to rectify this issue ( teleport @e[type=phantom] ~0 ~-400 ~0 ) was no effort at all speaks to the frequency of this issue and the number of players who either searched for a way around this or acted in a way around this change.

And, Lastly, I have yet to come across a single benefit to phantoms spawning on mushroom islands.
You probably should balance it in a way to have it not fully replace boats.
Maybe a chance of falling off?

I really like the concept of surfing on a shield, but it needs a drawback to make sure it doesn't replace boats. Personally I would make it faster than regular boats, but only last for about ten seconds. After this point, the player would fall off, back into the water. Even with this nerf, it would still be fun to try out and utilize when escaping an island that's been overrun by mobs.
What if it kept going without stopping, like riding a pig? That would be an interesting nerf
What if the durability of the shield would lower as you used it, similar to soul speed?
I kinda like this, but I think it'd be better to just surf down hills and stuff and not water

Yeah, I think the player should "fall off" if 1) they move too slow, 2) if a mob such as a drowned hits them, 3) sometimes if they hit flowing water, and 4) if they hit a bubble column generated by a magma block. Columns generated by soulsand should launch the player higher than normal, but when they land they should fall off if they're looking downward or upward.

Could be cool to have Vindicator's open up portals through which the Pillagers spawn. Would make a bit more sense than them spawning out of nowhere like in the Overworld. I the Pillager's spawnrate should be at least increased by 50% to make it more difficult as well.

I dont think furniture is a good idea. Maybe chair and table but no more than that.
We could have real furniture in minecraft it will be better and more people want to play on it.
Furniture is a great idea, personally I think things like couches, bigger and fancier beds, tables, chairs, etc. That would make the game that much more fun to play.
Minecraft has said that they will never, ever add furniture of any kind.

It would be great if villagers would just pick a bed and work station and then keep them permanently unless they are actually obstructed or destroyed.

Sometimes, when they have a work station, they go to bed, and the next morning they have to either find a new block or reconnect with the first one. 

It can be an incredibly frustrating experience to build a village because of these issues.

Yes! I was just about to post a brand new one and saw this existing thread. A villager AI update would be fantastic! As it stands right now any second floor bed villagers have a hard time locating. They tend to stand under the floor staring up at the bed all night long. They don't seem to understand how to navigate stairs and only randomly seem to be able to navigate ladders. This creates so much wasted space in my cities! I build a really cool City with amazing houses and the villagers don't seem to be able to find their way upstairs. And I get tired of providing first floor bedrooms to every house. Villager AI update is sorely needed in my opinion

And lets not for get that Villager jumping off cliffs to there death and just flat out go missing for day and weeks at a time. I have taken a normal Village and built it up with more building and house and all. Like said in this post. they cant find there Job Block much less their Beds or the village meeting place (village center/center of town)
Well, let's admit we all want to actually go to Minecraft space... Sounds like a step in the right direction!
Might be a cool feature, but in my opinion it doesnt feel like it fits.

in order to look at them you could craft a mounted telescope using a telescope 2 gold and 2 copper in an upside down v and the mounted one could see them also during day time where as if you don't have a telescope mount you would look at the sky during night
With Telescopes, you could be able to see meteor showers, shooting stars, etc..And maybe even have crashed meteors as structures.

Perhaps stars should have different colors. Most of them could be white or faintly blue, but perhaps a few should be red or orange. Perhaps some stars are brighter than others. Perhaps you could see random planets when you look up into the sky. Perhaps you could occasionally see comets or shooting stars

As stars vary on world seed, planets should too. A variety of planets could be pulled off by having several base "surface" textures, sometimes "ocean" textures, and also "atmosphere" textures. Perhaps some kind of star chart could be made, to encourage players to create constellations.

Doing this would add new possibilities of roleplaying and new levels of world immersion. Looking up at night should make players feel small and insignificant, while filling them with awe, wonder, and curiosity. Compared with other things, this should be really light and simple to add, yet the game will feel so much richer for it.
This astronomy feature would likely be useful for navigation. This should be accompanied by the addition of the sextant to measure the height of the moon, stars, and planets above the horizon.

maybe constellations can point you to strongholds sometimes. Adding light pollution would also make the game much more realistic as you would have to keep the area around you dark so that you can see all of the constellations. Maybe even make it so that when the moon is new you can see the farthest. A new villager type in general, the astronomer could also come with this along with a new villager structure, tripods, and telescopes. lenses would add even further upgrades o your telescope o make things clearer and clearer for farther and farther.

This would help them incorporate seasons into biomes, having a mapped out night sky for the game to follow and effect the seasons to trigger in certain areas at certain times. Also this opens the door for new things not only like astrology but chemistry, engineering, and more that would be like crafting and smelting. New game mechanics such as different physics or forces of nature can be added, new materials and tools can be added, and eventually players could explore the Minecraft Universe.

I would love to be able to see planets in the night sky. Of course they wouldn't be obviously planets without a telescope. If the textures were codes small enough, they would appear as a single bright pixel on a screen, but if you use a telescope, you could see all sorts of different planets. Each world seed would have randomly generated planets. Like in real astronomy, though, you would be able to find out which stars were actually planets by tracking their movements like ancient astronomers did.

This is a great idea!

Yeah this really limits the creativity of... crouching at people, looking at people and punching them?

I feel like this is a really pretentious way of saying "fortnite bad minecraft good".
This has nothing to do with fornite?

There's not too much of a downside, though...

With crouching and punching, there's still only so much that you can do. I'm completely okay with emotes, since they add more functionality and personality to the Minecraft characters, and it would allow more hand motions to be done.
In my opinion, there is no personality in performing a cookie-cutter animation. Minecraft is all about creating whatever you want from the tools you are given, not having premade things handed to you

I think the issue people have with emotes in Minecraft is that it's only meant to rip off of Fortnite with all the dances they have, when in reality, it could just add that much more personality into multiplayer experiences

I agree strongly that there should NOT be Emotes. BUT if you guys real want it then here are some ideas.

#1- make it a marketplace pack for like $15 and slowly add more Emotes for free to the people who bought it.

#2- if you do go with the first option then add a way to disable it and or make it so the world/sever host can ban Emotes. (so they aren't ruining the game by being annoying)

#3-make it so that a Emotes are removed from servers unless the Host says so. like Mineplex would be ruined if some guy is Dabbing right next to you  when you are trying to hide.

#4-Lastly (if you do add Emotes) try not to make them at all like "Fortnite" and also don't make them to cringe.

I and a lot of people think these Emotes are going to ruin the game. and they probably are, but I, and probably a lot of other people think that if you follow these rules they you could help. It still wouldn't be the best, but better. 

So please, (for all of your hundreds of millions of fans), please don't add Emotes.

This is a bad idea. The threat of having your items despawn is part of the challenge of the game - otherwise there is no real punishment for dying.

If you really don't like the fact that items will despawn after death, then set the gamerule /KeepInventory to true, that way, you get to keep all of your items after you die.

If such a feature were to be implemented, I‚Äôd imagine that the devs would make up new holidays, rather than using national holidays or religious holidays. For instance, Villagers may celebrate Minecraft‚Äôs release anniversaries, The release anniversaries of the 1.14 update. They could also celebrate the defeat of raids each in-game year (365 in-game days) after the raid, but probably for only a certain amount of years.
And maybe even Minecraft day! And April fools

I don't think existing holidays should exist in MC. They're based on real-world religions and cultures and MC is a fantasy world devoid of those. At least, maybe they should have their own made-up holidays or leave it players to create them.

I completely agree- I don't play myself, but my daughter does. She has a learning disability and it takes her a little time to process the game, also she needs the odd pause to prevent her from becoming overwhelmed. I appreciate that game development is incredibly complex, but enabling a pause function would make Minecraft so much more accessible to those who share my daughter's disability.
